data.title: Interstellar re release date: Christopher Nolan's film's IMAX print destroyed? Here are details
data.meta_description: Christopher Nolan's much acclaimed film 'Interstellar' received positive reviews as it was liked by a wider section of audience.
data.text:
Synopsis

Christopher Nolan's much acclaimed film 'Interstellar' received positive reviews as it was liked by a wider section of audience.

Christopher Nolan's 'Interstellar' IMAX prints may have been lost forever as Paramount has reportedly destroyed the IMAX reels of Oscar winner director's sci-fi epic, as per a report on dexerto.

However, both Nolan or IMAX authority are yet to comment on the issue. 'Interstellar' was released in 2014 in 70 mm IMAX format and traditional 35 mm, dexerto reported.

Earlier, in April this year, it was announced that 'Interstellar' would be re-released on September 27, 2024.

Also Read: Delta Force: Hawk Ops Twitch Drops: All you may want to know

Recently, James Gunn has commemorated the tenth anniversary of the release of 'Guardians of the Galaxy', reflecting on a decade of interstellar adventure that has left a significant mark on the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).

Taking to Instagram, Gunn shared a nostalgic photograph from the film's promotional tour, featuring himself alongside stars Chris Pratt and Dave Bautista.

FAQs:

Q1. Who directed 'Interstellar'?

A1. Christopher Nolan was the director of 'Interstellar'.

Q2. Which format 'Interstellar' was released?

A2. 'Interstellar' was released in 2014 in 70 mm IMAX format and traditional 35 mm.
